prerequisites: Basic understanding of physical and chemical changes
Familiarity with everyday objects and their properties
learning_outcomes: Students will be able to distinguish between reversible and irreversible changes.
Students will be able to identify and group changes based on their characteristics.
Students will be able to observe and analyze changes in their surroundings.
key_concepts: Observing and analyzing changes in everyday objects
suggested_examples: Blowing up and deflating a balloon
Folding and unfolding a piece of paper
Making a roti from dough and baking it
Heating and cooling a metal rim to fit onto a wooden wheel
